channel.title: Prob very simple but need help :)
channel.description:
When im NOT using SRL and i define x and y and integers ClickMouse(x,y,true) etc work perfectly.
but when i AM using SRL which has them allready defined, it does not work. It instead clicks at point 0,0 as tho x and why have been defined as 0.
any help?

item.title: Prob very simple but need help :)
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

if u want to chnage it like i did edit it so the function you want sets x and y for example i made MMouse set x and y because it is my prefered mouse function but doesnt set x,y, so it maked it abit of a pain to click after youve moved as it adds slight randomness

add something like x := dx; y := dy;

Read full topic
item.source: Prob very simple but need help :)

item.title: Prob very simple but need help :)
item.dc:creator: @tonekray tonekray
item.description:
@tonekray wrote:

[quote=“nix, post:3, topic:13140”]maybe you didnt understand my post
I dont define them when using SRL cus they are allready in globals but when i try to use x and y they allways take the value of zero not what they should do[/quote]

Oh my bad, That happens sometimes to me.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Well when you’re using SRL, just change the x and y variables to x5 and y5 that way nothign will conflict with each other.
